title: Arpita Saggar
text:
Hello!

I’m a PhD student at the UKRI Centre for Doctoral Training in AI for Medical Diagnosis and Care at the University of Leeds. My doctoral research is focused on the simulation of virtual patients to support medical training, and I’m fortunate to be supervised by Professor David Hogg, Dr Duygu Sarikaya, Dr Jonathan Darling and Professor Vania Dimitrova.
Before starting my PhD, I was a Data Science for Social Good fellow at the University of Warwick, where I worked with Save The Children and UNICEF to map multidimensional child poverty across sub-Saharan Africa. My background is in Computing, and I’ve previously worked on research projects at the intersection of AI and healthcare.
